chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
l: lb

Goal:
lb_shift 0 l = l

Premises:
lb_shift = fun (n : nat) (l : lb) => lb_bots n ++ l : nat -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_shift _%nat_scope _%list_scope
Notation lb := (list bool)
lb_bots = fix lb_bots (n : nat) : lb := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => ⟘ :: lb_bots n0 end : nat -> lb Arguments lb_bots _%nat_scope
g_nlb_ind : forall P : nat -> lb -> Prop, P 0 nil -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟘ :: l)) -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟙ :: l)) -> forall (n : nat) (l : lb), g_nlb n l -> P n l
g_nlb_sind : forall P : nat -> lb -> SProp, P 0 nil -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟘ :: l)) -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟙ :: l)) -> forall (n : nat) (l : lb), g_nlb n l -> P n l
Inductive g_nlb : nat -> lb -> Prop := in_gnlb_0 : g_nlb 0 nil | in_gnlb_1 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> g_nlb n (⟘ :: l) | in_gnlb_2 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> g_nlb n (⟙ :: l) Arguments g_nlb _%nat_scope _%list_scope Arguments in_gnlb_1 [n]%nat_scope [l]%list_scope Arguments in_gnlb_2 [n]%nat_scope [l]%list_scope
lb_nat = fix lb_nat (l : lb) : nat := match l with | nil => 0 | x :: l0 => bool2nat x + 2 * lb_nat l0 end : lb -> nat Arguments lb_nat _%list_scope
lb_mask_equiv = fun l m : lb => l ⪯ m /\ m ⪯ l : lb -> lb -> Prop Arguments lb_mask_equiv (_ _)%list_scope
nat_lb_1 = eq_ind_r (fun l : lb => l = ⟙ :: nil) (eq_ind_r (fun l : lb => ⟙ :: l = ⟙ :: nil) eq_refl nat_lb_fix_0) (nat_lb_fix_2 0) : ⟬ 1 ⟭ = ⟙ :: nil
lb_meet = lb_pointwise andb : lb -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_meet (_ _)%list_scope
lb_join = lb_pointwise orb : lb -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_join (_ _)%list_scope
lb_nat_fix_0 = eq_refl : ⟦ nil ⟧ = 0
in_gnlb_1 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> g_nlb n (⟘ :: l)
nat_lb_fix_0 = g_nlb_fun (nat_lb_spec 0) in_gnlb_0 : ⟬ 0 ⟭ = nil
rem_2_fix_1 : forall n : nat, rem (2 * n) 2 = 0
lb_ortho_ind : forall P : lb -> lb -> Prop, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, P l nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⟂ l0 -> P l l0
lb_ortho_sind : forall P : lb -> lb -> SProp, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, P l nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⟂ l0 -> P l l0
lb_plus = fix lb_plus (a : bool) (l m : lb) {struct l} : lb := match l with | nil => lb_succ a m | x :: l0 => match m with | nil => lb_succ a l | y :: m0 => let (r, z) := bin_add a x y in z :: lb_plus r l0 m0 end end : bool -> lb -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_plus _%bool_scope (_ _)%list_scope
lb_succ = fix lb_succ (a : bool) (l : lb) {struct l} : lb := match l with | nil => a :: nil | x :: l0 => let (r, z) := bin_add ⟘ a x in z :: lb_succ r l0 end : bool -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_succ _%bool_scope _%list_scope
Inductive lb_ortho : lb -> lb -> Prop := in_lb_ortho_0 : forall l : lb, nil ⟂ l | in_lb_ortho_1 : forall l : lb, l ⟂ nil | in_lb_ortho_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> x :: l ⟂ y :: m Arguments lb_ortho (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lb_ortho_0 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_ortho_1 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_ortho_2 [x y]%bool_scope [l m]%list_scope
in_gnlb_2 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> g_nlb n (⟙ :: l)
bool2nat = fun x : bool => if x then 1 else 0 : bool -> nat Arguments bool2nat _%bool_scope
nat_lb_fix_1 : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> ⟬ 2 * n ⟭ = ⟘ :: ⟬ n ⟭
lb_pointwise = fun f : bool -> bool -> bool => fix lb_pointwise (l m : lb) {struct l} : lb := match l with | nil => match m with | nil => nil | _ :: _ => map (f ⟘) m end | x :: l0 => match m with | nil => map (fun x0 : bool => f x0 ⟘) l | y :: m0 => f x y :: lb_pointwise l0 m0 end end : (bool -> bool -> bool) -> lb -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_pointwise _%function_scope (_ _)%list_scope
natr_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list nat) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N * Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0 1 add mul (SRsub add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) eq BinNat.N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 mul) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 add mul (SRsub add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) BinNat.N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 mul) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 add mul (SRsub add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) BinNat.N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 mul) l pe2
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
BinNatDef.N.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.N0 | S n' => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n') end : nat -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.of_nat _%nat_scope
nat_lb = let nat_lb_full := fun n : nat => measure_rect (fun n0 : nat => n0) (fun n0 : nat => {l : lb | g_nlb n0 l}) (fun (n0 : nat) (IHn : forall y : nat, y < n0 -> {l : lb | g_nlb y l}) => let s := Nat.eq_dec n0 0 in match s with | left e => exist (fun l : lb => g_nlb n0 l) nil (eq_ind_r (fun n1 : nat => (forall y : nat, y < n1 -> {l : lb | g_nlb y l}) -> g_nlb n1 nil) (fun _ : forall y : nat, y < 0 -> {l : lb | g_nlb y l} => in_gnlb_0) e IHn) | right Hn => let s0 := IHn (div n0 2) (div_by_p_lt ((fun lemma : 2 <= 2 <-> BinInt.Z.le (BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) (...
lb_nat_eq_Proper = fun (x y : lb) (H : x ≂ y) => (let H0 : forall l m : lb, l ≂ m -> ⟦ l ⟧ = ⟦ m ⟧ := fun l m : lb => match lb_mask_equiv_equal l m with | conj x0 _ => x0 end in H0) x y H : Morphisms.Proper (lb_mask_equiv ==> eq) lb_nat Expanded type for implicit arguments lb_nat_eq_Proper : forall [x y : lb], x ≂ y -> ⟦ x ⟧ = ⟦ y ⟧ Arguments lb_nat_eq_Proper [x y]
Ascii.N_of_digits = fix N_of_digits (l : lb) : BinNums.N := match l with | nil => BinNums.N0 | b :: l' => BinNat.N.add (if b then BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH else BinNums.N0) (BinNat.N.mul (BinNums.Npos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) (N_of_digits l')) end : lb -> BinNums.N Arguments Ascii.N_of_digits _%list_scope
lb_mask_sind : forall P : lb -> lb -> SProp, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> P l nil -> P (⟘ :: l) nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⪯ l0 -> P l l0
lb_mask_ind : forall P : lb -> lb -> Prop, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> P l nil -> P (⟘ :: l) nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⪯ l0 -> P l l0
Inductive lb_mask : lb -> lb -> Prop := in_lb_mask_0 : forall l : lb, nil ⪯ l | in_lb_mask_1 : forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil | in_lb_mask_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m Arguments lb_mask (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_0 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_1 [l]%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_2 (_ _)%bool_scope [l m]%list_scope
div_by_p_lt : forall p n : nat, 2 <= p -> n <> 0 -> div n p < n
filter_map : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l < -> map f l = map g l
lb_meet_app : forall l m a b : lb, length l = length m -> (l ++ a) ↓ (m ++ b) = l ↓ m ++ a ↓ b
lb_meet_comm : forall l m : lb, l ↓ m = m ↓ l
lb_join_comm : forall l m : lb, l ↑ m = m ↑ l
lb_succ_spec_0 : forall l : lb, ⟦ lb_succ ⟘ l ⟧ = ⟦ l ⟧
lb_succ_spec_1 : forall l : lb, ⟦ lb_succ ⟙ l ⟧ = S ⟦ l ⟧
map_ext : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B), (forall a : A, f a = g a) -> forall l : list A, map f l = map g l
lb_complement : forall a b : lb, {c : lb | b ⟂ c /\ a ↑ b ≂ c ↑ b}

```  
intros. unfold lb_shift. unfold lb_bots. reflexivity.
```
